In this tutorial we will use Graph Differential Equations (GDEs) to perform classification on the
. We shall be using the Graph Neural Networks primitives from the package
# Preprocess the data and compute adjacency matrix
The dataset is available in the desired format in the GeometricFlux repository. We shall download the dataset from there, and use the JLD2 package to load the data.
are defined by the data itself. We shall use a shallow GNN with only 16 hidden state dimension.
Convert the data to float32 and use
to get the adjacency matrix from the graph
Let us now define the final model. We will use a single layer GNN for approximating the gradients for the neural ODE. We use two additional

layers, one to project the data to a latent space and the other to project it from the latent space to the predictions. Finally a softmax layer gives us the probability of the input belonging to each target category.
We shall be using the standard categorical crossentropy loss function which is used for multiclass classification tasks.
Now we extract the model parameters which we want to learn.
GNNs operate on an entire graph, so we can't do any sort of minibatching here. We need to pass the entire data in a single pass. So our dataset is an array with a single tuple.
For this task we will be using the

We also define a utility function for printing the accuracy of the model over time.
